Company: Morton Plant Mease BayCare Health SystemHospital
Description: Fifty-five hospitals in 21 states agreed to pay the United States a total of more than $34 million to settle allegations that they submitted false claims to Medicare for kyphoplasty, a minimally-invasive procedure used to treat certain spinal fractures that often are due to osteoporosis.

Company: Morton Plant Mease Health Care Inc.
Description: Morton Plant Mease Health Care Inc. and its affiliated hospitals agreed to pay $10,169,114 to the federal government to resolve allegations that they violated the False Claims Act by submitting false claims for services rendered to Medicare patients.

Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Winter Haven Hospital agreed to pay $75,000 to resolve its liability for Civil Monetary Penalties under the patient dumping statute.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
U.S. Attorney-Western District of New York

Company: Morton Plant Hospital and Mease Hospital
Description: Morton Plant Hospital and Mease Hospital agreed to pay $300,000 to charitable groups in settlement of allegations they broke antitrust law when setting up a joint managed care office after merging.
